availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Cochran (Lexington, Kentucky, insurance agent)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, insurance agent. Kentucky native. Married to Theodosia S. Cochran. Father of John Cochran, Nathan P. Cochran, Kate Cochran, and Mary Cochran. Owned six enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Insurance agent in Lexington in 1860. Confirmed as a notary public in Fayette County on February 5, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 4, p. 91.
Find A Grave, "James W. Cochran (1812-1885)," Memorial #100096802, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100096802 (accessed September 28, 2018).
KYR-0001-017-0062.
